alert.note: Alert for Boone; Madison; Platte (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:54AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Madison, Platte and eastern Boone Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Petersburg to 5 miles north of Fullerton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newman Grove around 310 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Madison, Duncan, Platte Center and Monroe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
